newsitem.title: UK: UK TV watchdog eyes planned Caledonian acquisition.
newsitem.headline: UK TV watchdog eyes planned Caledonian acquisition.

text.p: Britain's Independent Television Commission (ITC) on Wednesday said it is reviewing the proposed acquisition of Caledonian Publishing Plc by Scottish Television Plc.
The ITC, the main television watchdog, said it is considering the proposed move under the public interest test of the Broadcasting Act 1996.
The new rules in the Broadcasting Act remove some previous restrictions on cross-media ownership of newspaper publishers and terrestrial television licensees.
The ITC, however, is required in some circumstances to consider whether such cross holdings operate, or could be expected to operate, against the public interest.
